tag.description: Set to true when the client is supposed to reconnect automatically.

tag.name: var
tag.description: True if this is consuming multiple hashes

tag.name: var
tag.description: The array of hashes to be consumed if using multi

docblock.description: Factory function.
docblock.long-description: Creates a StreamConsumer-derived object for the given type.

tag.name: param
tag.description: CSDL string or a Definition object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The object that will receive events.

docblock.description: Constructor.
docblock.long-description: Do not use this directly, use the factory method instead.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The user this consumer will run as.

tag.name: param
tag.description: CSDL string, a Definition object, or an array of hashes.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The object that will receive events.

docblock.description: This is called when a complete JSON item is received.
This is called when the underlying stream is connected.
This is called for each interaction received from the stream and must be implemented in extending classes.
This is called for each DELETE request received from the stream and must be implemented in extending classes.
Called for each status message received from the stream.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data received along with the status message.

docblock.description: This is called when an error notification is received on a stream connection.
This is called when a warning notification is received on a scream connection.
This is called when the underlying stream is disconnected.
This is called when the consumer is stopped.
Once an instance of a StreamConsumer is ready for use, call this to start consuming.
docblock.long-description: Extending classes should implement onStart to handle actually starting.

docblock.description: Called when the consumer should start consuming the stream.
This method can be called at any time to *request* that the consumer stop consuming.
docblock.long-description: This method sets the state to STATE_STOPPING and it's up to the consumer implementation to notice that this has changed, stop consuming and call the onStopped method.

docblock.description: Default implementation of onStop.
docblock.long-description: It's unlikely that this method will ever be used in isolation, but rather it should be called as the final step in the extending class's implementation.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Reason why the stream was stopped

docblock.description: The DataSift_User class represents a user of the API.
docblock.long-description: Applications should start their API interactions by creating an instance of this class. Once initialised it provides factory methods for all of the functionality in the API.

docblock.description: The DataSift_Definition class represents a stream definition.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The hash creation time as a UNIX timestamp.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The total number of DPUs used.

docblock.description: Constructor.
docblock.long-description: A DataSift_User object is required, and you can optionally supply a default definition string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An optional hash for the passed definition.

docblock.description: Returns the definition string.
Sets the definition string.
Returns the hash for this definition.
docblock.long-description: If the hash has not yet been obtained it compiles the definition first.

docblock.description: Reset the hash to false.
docblock.long-description: The effect of this is to mark the definition as requiring compilation. Also resets other variables that depend on the CSDL.

docblock.description: Returns the date when the stream was first created.
docblock.long-description: If the created at date has not yet been obtained it validates the definition first.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The date as a unix timestamp.

docblock.description: Returns the total DPU of the stream.
docblock.long-description: If the DPU has not yet been obtained it validates the definition first.

docblock.description: Call the DataSift API to compile this defintion.
docblock.long-description: On success it will store the returned hash.

docblock.description: Call the DataSift API to validate this defintion.
docblock.long-description: On success it will store the returned hash.

docblock.description: Call the DataSift API to get the DPU for this definition.
docblock.long-description: Returns an array containing... dpu => The breakdown of running the rule total => The total dpu of the rule

docblock.description: Call the DataSift API to get buffered interactions.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional number of interactions to return (max 200).

docblock.description: Get a page of push subscriptions in the given user's account, where each page contains up to per_page items.

Get the current status of this subscription.

docblock.description: Returns true if this subscription has been deleted.
